item.title: Optimal designs - how to avoid the pitfalls of grand landmark building projects?
item.description: The Eiffel Tower, the Sydney Opera House, the London Garden Bridge. The recent demise of the proposed Garden Bridge across the Thames raises the question of when public support for radical buildings should occur. Unique buildings, by their nature, are hard to evaluate based on experience and their construction can turn out to be unexpectedly expensive. However, they have also resulted in some of the world’s most popular and distinctive buildings – central to many cities’ identity and tourism.
